tone_framing: Frame the tour as a science expedition to uncover the secrets of ancient materials and global trade.
key_takeaways: Ceramics were a crucial part of global trade, shaping cultural connections between countries.
Material properties such as firing temperature, glaze composition, and clay type determine the quality and appearance of ceramics.
The blue-and-white export wares were customized for specific cultural needs, like the Japanese tea ceremony.
